items: Complication of medicinal use of leeches to debride wounds.
Wound infection from Aeromonas hydrophila found in the intestinal tract of leeches.

regimenData.notes: Choice of alternative agents based on susceptibility testing. Aeromonas sp. universally resistant to ampicillin, penicillin and cefazolin

items: Some use prophylactic antibiotics when leeches are used medicinally, but not universally accepted as necessary. Some base this on periodic microbiologic sampling of leech tank fluid (Eur J Clin Microbiol Infect Dis 35:1001, 2016)
Cellulitis due to Ciprofloxacin-resistant Aeromonas hydrophila from medicinal leech use has been described, J Clin Microbiol 51:1324, 2013.
Other organisms such as Vibrio spp. have been encountered, Clin Infect Dis 22:709, 1996.
